p: We have previously described the role of VP1-98 and VP1-145 as modulators of heparin-binding in cell culture [ 39]. In the present study, we elucidated the role of heparin-binding in shaping EV-A71 virulence in mice. Five EV-A71 variants were engineered from a laboratory-adapted EV-A71 strain (5865/SIN/00009, subgenogroup B4), which posesses VP2-149K, VP1-98E and VP1-145Q residues (designated as KEQ, following amino acid residue order). Site-directed mutagenesis was performed to generate the five variants denoted as KKQ, KKE, KEE, IEE and IEQ ( Fig 1A). Some variants had the mouse-adaptive determinant, K149I [ 24, 26, 40] along with substitutions in the heparin-binding determinants, VP1-98 and VP1-145. After a single passage, all EV-A71 variants were viable with comparable plaque morphology ( Fig 1B) and were confirmed by sequencing ( S1 Fig).
